channel.title: Azure Nigeria Community
channel.description: Recent content on Azure Nigeria Community

item.title: Threat Detection, Incident Response & AI Safety
item.description:
Prepare your team for detection and response with Azure-native tooling and AI safety practices.

What You’ll Learn

  • Sentinel playbooks and response readiness
  • AI safety guardrails for production systems
  • Monitoring and alerting best practices

item.title: Governance, Risk & Compliance
item.description:
Build governance guardrails and compliance readiness for Azure teams.

What You’ll Learn

  • Azure Policy, blueprints, and audit trails
  • Risk registers and compliance mapping
  • Operational governance practices

item.title: Azure in Production
item.description:
Continue the Cloud Leadership Series with a second Azure in Production session focused on operational excellence and real-world Azure stories.

This series runs virtually every Saturday at 11am to 12pm WAT and may be subject to name change.

What You’ll Learn

  • Scaling practices and performance tuning for production Azure apps
  • Incident response basics for cloud workloads

Who Should Attend

  • Cloud engineers and reliability teams
  • Azure practitioners preparing for production launches

item.title: DevSecOps Engineering
item.description:
Embed security into delivery pipelines with practical DevSecOps patterns for Azure teams.

What You’ll Learn

  • Secure pipelines and policy-driven deployments
  • Secrets management and scanning automation
  • Compliance-ready delivery workflows

item.title: Infrastructure & Data Protection
item.description:
Learn how to protect Azure infrastructure and data with segmentation, encryption, and recovery planning.

What You’ll Learn

  • Network segmentation and encryption baselines
  • Backup, recovery, and resilience planning
  • Protecting data throughout its lifecycle

item.title: Azure in Production
item.description:
Join the Cloud Leadership Series for an Azure in Production deep dive focused on real-world use cases from Azure engineers.

This series runs virtually every Saturday at 11am to 12pm WAT and may be subject to name change.

What You’ll Learn

  • Production readiness and launch checklists for Azure workloads
  • Reliability and monitoring patterns teams can apply immediately

Who Should Attend

  • Cloud engineers and platform teams
  • Developers shipping Azure workloads to production

item.title: Identity & Access Management
item.description:
Strengthen identity and access controls with Entra ID fundamentals and role-based access management.

What You’ll Learn

  • Entra ID fundamentals and RBAC patterns
  • Privileged access workflows and MFA strategy
  • Identity governance essentials

item.title: Cloud Security & Zero Trust
item.description:
Build a security-first foundation for Azure workloads with zero trust strategies and practical guardrails.

What You’ll Learn

  • Zero trust principles for Azure environments
  • Security posture planning for modern teams
  • Practical steps to harden new deployments

item.title: Top 5 Azure Certifications for Nigerian Developers
item.description:
Azure certifications help validate your skills and open doors to new opportunities.

1. AZ-900: Azure Fundamentals

Perfect for beginners starting their cloud journey.

2. AZ-104: Azure Administrator

Ideal for professionals managing Azure infrastructure.

3. AZ-204: Azure Developer

Great for developers building cloud-native apps.

4. DP-900: Azure Data Fundamentals

Best for data enthusiasts exploring Azure data services.

5. AI-900: Azure AI Fundamentals

A strong entry point for AI and machine learning on Azure.

item.title: Recap: Our First Virtual Azure Workshop
item.description:
Our first community workshop brought together hundreds of learners across Nigeria.

Key Takeaways

  • Cloud basics and core Azure services
  • Cost management strategies
  • Certification preparation roadmap

Whatâ€™s Next

More hands-on labs, live Q&A, and certification study sessions are on the way.

item.title: Azure Fundamentals Workshop Recap
item.description:
Our kickoff Azure Fundamentals session brought together learners across Nigeria to explore the Azure cloud platform.

Session Highlights

  • Core Azure services overview
  • Pricing and cost management basics
  • Cloud security fundamentals
  • AZ-900 exam preparation strategy

Recording & Resources

  • Watch the recording
  • Slides and sample repo

item.title: Welcome to Azure Nigeria Community
item.description:
Azure Nigeria Community is a thriving community of developers, cloud enthusiasts, and tech professionals passionate about Microsoft Azure and cloud technologies. Our mission is to build, nurture, and showcase Nigerian talent in the global cloud computing space.

What We Do

  • Instructor-led training and hands-on workshops from Azure fundamentals to advanced services
  • Real-world projects to build solutions with Azure technologies
  • Networking and collaboration with fellow developers and industry professionals
  • Knowledge sharing with experienced Azure practitioners and Microsoft MVPs
  • Career development and certification prep for cloud roles

How to Get Involved

Join our Meetup, attend sessions, and start building with the community. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter/X for updates and event announcements.

item.title: AI Fundamentals on Azure
item.description:
This four-part series delivered practical guidance on building AI solutions with Azure services.

Series Outline

Session 1: AI on Azure Overview

  • Service landscape and use cases
  • Responsible AI principles
  • Watch Recording

Session 2: Data & Model Prep

  • Data labeling and curation
  • Experimentation workflows
  • Watch Recording

Session 3: Deployment

  • Azure ML deployment patterns
  • Monitoring and governance
  • Watch Recording

Session 4: Building Apps

  • Integrating AI in real apps
  • Cost and performance tuning
  • Watch Recording

item.title: Azure DevOps Mastery Series
item.description:
This series is designed for engineers ready to ship and automate production-grade workloads on Azure.

Series Outline

Session 1: Introduction (Completed)

  • Azure DevOps platform overview
  • Setting up projects and permissions
  • Watch Recording

Session 2: Repositories (Completed)

  • Git workflows with Azure Repos
  • Branch policies and code reviews
  • Watch Recording

Session 3: Build Pipelines (Completed)

  • YAML pipelines
  • Build agents and caching

Session 4: Release Pipelines (Completed)

  • Release strategies and approvals
  • Environment promotion workflows

Session 5: Infrastructure as Code (Completed)

  • ARM/Bicep deployment patterns
  • Reusable pipeline templates

Session 6: Monitoring and Governance (Completed)

  • Pipeline observability
  • Compliance-ready audit trails

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: We respect your privacy. We only collect information needed to run community events, newsletters, and communications. We never sell your data and you can opt out at any time by emailing hello@azurenigeria.org.

item.title: Terms of Use
item.description: By participating in Azure Nigeria Community events and discussions, you agree to maintain a respectful, inclusive environment. We reserve the right to remove disruptive content or behavior.
